sentences: Amy Lee (born May 30, 1989), known professionally as Ailee, is a Korean-American singer and songwriter based in South Korea.
section: N/A

sentences: Amassing digital sales success in South Korea, she has released two studio albums, five extended plays, and twenty one singles, six of which charted within the top five of the Gaon Digital Chart.
section: N/A

sentences: Following a short stint at Muzo Entertainment in New York City, Ailee moved to South Korea in 2010 and signed with YMC Entertainment.
section: N/A

sentences: She debuted in 2012 with her first single "Heaven", which peaked at number three on the Gaon Digital Chart and earned her Best New Artist Awards at the Melon Music Awards, Golden Disc Awards, Gaon Chart K-Pop Awards, and Seoul Music Awards.
section: N/A

sentences: She won four consecutive Mnet Asian Music Award for Best Female Vocal Performance titles from 2013 to 2016, with "U&I", "Singing Got Better", "Mind Your Own Business", and "If You" respectively.
section: N/A

sentences: Her 2017 single, "I Will Go to You Like the First Snow", recorded for the soundtrack of the television drama series Guardian: The Lonely and Great God (2016), won several awards and was the most digitally successful song of that year, becoming the best-selling record in movies and dramas in the Korean sound record market.
section: N/A
== Life and career ==

sentences: Life and career ==
section: == Life and career ==
== Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: Ailee was born in Denver, Colorado, on May 30, 1989, and grew up in New Jersey.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: She attended Palisades Park High School before moving to nearby Leonia.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: After her Scotch Plains-Fanwood High School graduation, she studied communications at Pace University before dropping out to pursue a career in music.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: Before her K-pop debut, Ailee was signed under Muzo Entertainment, an independent agency in New York City and New Jersey.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: Under that label she collaborated with several artists, including Johnnyphlo and Philadelphia-based rapper Decipher.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: Before moving to South Korea, Ailee created the YouTube channels "mzamyx3" and "aileemusic" to bring attention to her singing on the web.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: Ailee moved to South Korea in 2010 after she landed a music label audition through her uncle's connections, she sang "Resignation" by Big Mama during the audition, and was recruited for YMC Entertainment on the spot.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: During her training, YMC featured her in the label's Wheesung song, "They Are Coming", which it released in October 2011.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: She also sang in Decipher and Jay Park's song "Catch Me If You Can".
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: In September 2011, Ailee and Wheesung were featured on the MBC's Chuseok special episode of Singer and Trainee.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: Ailee performed "Halo" by Beyoncé to a positive reaction from the audience.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: Following her performance of "Halo", judge BMK said, "Wherever she goes, she has the potential to be a big star.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: She definitely has the voice."
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===

sentences: After the judges had graded all the participants, Ailee was the first-place winner.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2011: Early life, career beginnings ===
== Life and career == | === 2012: Debut and commercial success ===
== Life and career == | === 2012: Debut and commercial success ===

sentences: Debut and commercial success ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2012: Debut and commercial success ===

sentences: On February 9, 2012, Ailee released her debut single "Heaven" along with the music video, which featured Gi Kwang of Beast.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012: Debut and commercial success ===

sentences: On the same day, she made her debut stage performance of "Heaven" on M Countdown.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012: Debut and commercial success ===

sentences: Billboard commented, "From her debut single, Ailee proved that she had an ability beyond her years to communicate the deeper experiences one feels in love.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012: Debut and commercial success ===

sentences: In this dedication track, Ailee's partner protected her and taught her how to love in a harsh world."
section: == Life and career == | === 2012: Debut and commercial success ===

sentences: The success of the single, helped Ailee win her first award at the 2012 Cyworld Digital Music Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012: Debut and commercial success ===

sentences: The single received the Song of the month (February) and Rookie of the month at the award ceremony.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012: Debut and commercial success ===

sentences: On October 16, 2012, Ailee released her debut EP, Invitation, with the title track "I Will Show You".
section: == Life and career == | === 2012: Debut and commercial success ===

sentences: The EP contained a total of six tracks.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012: Debut and commercial success ===

sentences: It was produced by producers such as Kim Do-hoon, Lee Hyun-seung, Park Guen-tae, Duble Sidekick, Wheesung, and featured artists such as Verbal Jint, Swings and Simon Dominic.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012: Debut and commercial success ===

sentences: In 2012, Ailee was awarded the Best New Artist Award at the Seoul Music Awards, Melon Music Awards, Mnet Asian Music Awards, and Golden Disk Awards, as well as the New Female Solo Artist Award at the Gaon Chart Music Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012: Debut and commercial success ===

sentences: She has also received the Mnet America Rising Star Award, a special award presented by Mnet America at the pre-show of 55th Grammy Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012: Debut and commercial success ===
== Life and career == | === 2013–2014: Commercial popularity ===

sentences: 2013–2014: Commercial popularity ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: Commercial popularity ===

sentences: On July 12, 2013, Ailee released her second Ep, titled A's Doll House.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: Commercial popularity ===

sentences: The EP's title track, "U&I" topped various music charts within four hours of release.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: Commercial popularity ===

sentences: On November 6, 2013, Ailee made her Japanese debut with Japanese-version of "Heaven" and "Starlight" under Warner Music Japan.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: Commercial popularity ===

sentences: On January 6, 2014, Ailee released a single titled "Singing Got Better", the single was produced by Wheesung.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: Commercial popularity ===

sentences: The song peaked at number one upon released on various music chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: Commercial popularity ===

sentences: The single has received the Best Vocal Performance at the 2014 Mnet Asian Music Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: Commercial popularity ===

sentences: On September 25, 2014, Ailee released her third EP, titled Magazine.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: Commercial popularity ===

sentences: The EP's title track, "Don't Touch Me" peaked at number one upon released on various music chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: Commercial popularity ===

sentences: The single has received the Digital Bonsang at the 2015 Golden Disc Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2014: Commercial popularity ===
== Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===

sentences: 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid =
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===
== Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===

sentences: After wrapping up her joint Unite the Mic Tour with Jay Park and San E in Toronto in March 2015, plans were revealed for Ailee to hold a solo concert three years after her debut.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===

sentences: Her first solo concert, titled Fatal Attraction, was held on July 4, 2015 at the Olympic Hall.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===

sentences: Ailee was joined on stage several times by different artists, who helped her sing her many duets and collaborations.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===

sentences: She sang "Shut Up" with Showry, "Like Nobody Knows" and "Comma 07" with Cheetah, "Wash Away" and "Officially Missing You" with Geeks, "NimA" and "Shower of Tears" with Baechigi, and "Touch My Body" and "Let"s Go Travel" with Shin Bo-ra.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===

sentences: Ailee's first full-length album Vivid was released on September 30, 2015.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===

sentences: She won her first trophy for this promotion on October 7, 2015 on Show Champion.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===

sentences: Ailee was awarded the Best Female Vocal Award for the third consecutive year at the 2015 Mnet Asian Music Awards, for "Mind Your Own Business".
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===

sentences: On July 13, 2016, Ailee was confirmed to participate as a judge on Superstar K 2016.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===

sentences: On August 23, 2016, Ailee released her single "If You", which subsequently topped the Gaon Weekly Chart for Digital Download.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===

sentences: On October 5, 2016, Ailee released her EP A New Empire, along with the music video for "Home" that was officially released on LOEN and YMC Entertainment's official YouTube channel.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===

sentences: A New Empire peaked at number 10 on the Gaon Album Chart, and number nine on the US World Albums (Billboard) Chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===

sentences: On December 2, 2016, Ailee was again awarded with Best Vocal Performance at the 2016 Mnet Asian Music Awards, this time for "If You", a record-breaking fourth consecutive win in the category.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2016: Breakthrough with Vivid ===
== Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: On January 7, 2017, Ailee released her debut American single "Fall Back" through WestSide Entertainment under the alias A. Leean.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: She also released the ballad "I Will Go to You Like the First Snow" (첫눈처럼 너에게 가겠다) on the same day as part nine in a series composed of singles for the South Korean cable television series Guardian: The Lonely and Great God.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: The single topped the Gaon Digital Chart for three consecutive weeks.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: The single earned Ailee the Best OST Award at the 2017 Korea Cable TV Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: The soundtrack has also received several accolades, including the best original soundtrack award at the Seoul International Drama Awards, the Mnet Asian Music Awards, the Melon Music Awards, the Seoul Music Awards and the Golden Disc Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: Ailee previously held two Christmas concerts in Seoul titled Welcome Home at Kyunghee University's Grand Peace Palace on December 24–25, 2016.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: Due to the success of the concerts, it was announced that Ailee would be holding her first nationwide tour, titled Welcome Home Tour, which started in Daegu on April 1, 2017.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: On June 25, 2017 in The City Hall at Taipei International Convention Center, Ailee held her first solo concert in Taiwan titled Ailee – Hello Taipei 2017.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: On November 18 and 19, Ailee held two concerts at the Pechanga Theater in California, selling out a total of 2,600 tickets combined.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: On March 18, 2018, Ailee performed "I Will Show You" at the closing ceremony of the 2018 Paralympic Winter Games at the Pyeongchang Olympic Stadium.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: On September 14, 2018, Ailee was chosen as a member of the South Korean cultural delegation, alongside other selected South Korean artists, for the third inter-Korean summit in Pyongyang, North Korea, where she performed her OST
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: "I Will Go to You Like the First Snow".
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: On November 23, 2018, Ailee announced her second nationwide tour, titled I Am: Ailee.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2018: OST success and solo concert tours ===

sentences: === 2019–present: Butterfly, continued touring, I'm, Lovin and Amy =
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Butterfly, continued touring, I'm, Lovin and Amy ===
== Life and career == | === 2019–present: Butterfly, continued touring, I'm, Lovin and Amy ===

sentences: Ailee released her second studio album, titled Butterfly, on July 2, 2019, with the lead single "Room Shaker".
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Butterfly, continued touring, I'm, Lovin and Amy ===

sentences: On September 10, 2019, Ailee announced on Instagram that she started a new company named, "Rocket3 Entertainment" after being signed with YMC Entertainment for eight years.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Butterfly, continued touring, I'm, Lovin and Amy ===

sentences: On December 13, 2019, Ailee released her first English language single under American label, Sun and Sky Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Butterfly, continued touring, I'm, Lovin and Amy ===

sentences: The single, entitled "Sweater", was hailed as "a heart-wrenching-yet-soothing ballad" by Billboard.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Butterfly, continued touring, I'm, Lovin and Amy ===

sentences: Ailee released her fifth extended play titled I'm on October 6, 2020, with the lead single "When We Were In Love".
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Butterfly, continued touring, I'm, Lovin and Amy ===

sentences: The music video was released on October 12, 2020 and was directed by Will Kim.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Butterfly, continued touring, I'm, Lovin and Amy ===

sentences: On November 8, 2020, Ailee released "Blue Bird", an OST that would be part nine of singles for the South Korean drama Start-Up.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Butterfly, continued touring, I'm, Lovin and Amy ===

sentences: On May 7, 2021, Ailee released her sixth extended play titled Lovin', ahead of the release of her third studio album.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Butterfly, continued touring, I'm, Lovin and Amy ===

sentences: The extended play includes two lead singles, "Make Up Your Mind" and "Spring Flowers".
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Butterfly, continued touring, I'm, Lovin and Amy ===

sentences: On July 22, 2021, Ailee joined new label The L1ve as their first official artist.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Butterfly, continued touring, I'm, Lovin and Amy ===

sentences: On October 14, 2021, it was announced that Ailee will be releasing her third studio album Amy on October 27, with the lead single "Don't Teach Me".
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Butterfly, continued touring, I'm, Lovin and Amy ===
